bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Alternative Names chi ding 赤丁 , red pin.

Pathological Condition of ding chuang 丁瘡 , pin sores, developing on the head and face, or in the region of the joints of hands and feet. When this disease breaks out it quickly leads to a serious condition accompanied by a generation of poison qi that will attack the heart. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry gou bao 狗寶 quotes Wai ke tong xuan lun 外科通玄論 : 赤疔瘡：狗寶丸：用狗 寶八分，蟾酥二錢，龍腦二錢，麝香一錢，為末，好酒和丸麻子大，每 服三丸 , “For red pin-illness sores : Pills with gou bao : Take gou bao , 8 fen ; chan su , 2 qian ; long nao , 2 qian ; she xiang , 1 qian . Grind to a powder. Use good wine and prepare pills the size of hemp seeds. Each time ingest 3 pills”. Chi fu yin lan 齒腐齦爛 , rotting teeth and gum putrescence [1]

Pathological Condition with rotten teeth and festering gums. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry lu jian 鹵鹼 quoting Xuan ming lun fang 宣明論方 15: 口齒腐蝕出血，斷根宣爛 , “The teeth in the mouth have rotted with erosion and are bleeding. This loosens the roots of the teeth, makes them unstable and causes them to fester”, writes: 齒腐齦爛 , “ Rotten teeth and gum putrescence ”.
